    • Method Detail

      • getInterview

        public static Interview getInterview(Project project,
                     java.lang.String interviewName)
        Gives Interview from database, identified by project and interviewName. This combination should be unique.
        Parameters:
        project - the parent project.
        interviewName - of the searched interview.
        Returns:
        the unique interview identified by project and interviewName.

      • getInterview

        public static Interview getInterview(java.util.UUID id)
        Gives Interview from database, identified by id.
        Parameters:
        id - - the id
        Returns:
        the unique interview identified by uuid.

      • findAllInterviews

        public static java.util.List<Interview> findAllInterviews(Project project)
        This function gives all Interviews existing in the database to the given project
        Returns:
        list of existing interviews of the given project

      • findAllInterviews

        public static java.util.List<Interview> findAllInterviews()
        This function gives all Interviews existing in the database
        Returns:
        list of existing interviews

      • createInterview

        public static Interview createInterview(Project project,
                        java.lang.String name)
        This is the Interview factory method. It needs an existing project and a name that does not exist in this scope. At the end of this method the new object is written to the database.
        Parameters:
        project - the parent project. It has to exist in the database.
        name - of the new interview. This must not exist in the current project

      • removeInterview

        public static boolean removeInterview(Interview interview)
        This function will remove the given interview from the database. EBeans will manage the deletion of all references automatically.
        Parameters:
        interview - - the interview to be deleted

      • getAudio

        public AudioFile getAudio()
        Gives the audio file.
        Returns:
        the audio file

      • setAudio

        public void setAudio(AudioFile audio)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the new audio of the interview and saves it to the database. This method throws an Exception if there is already an audio. There is no consistency check for the assigned audio. The upload has already to be done when this method is called.
        Parameters:
        audio - - the AudioFile object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getStatements

        public java.util.List<Statement> getStatements()
        This method gives all statements.
        Returns:
        all statements in this interview.

      • getStatementsSorted

        public java.util.List<Statement> getStatementsSorted()
        This method gives all statements sorted by time.
        Returns:
        all statements in this interview.

        public void addStatement(Statement statement)
        This method adds a statement to this interview
        Parameters:
        statement - the new statement

      • deleteStatement

        public void deleteStatement(Statement statement)
        Deletes the given statement.
        Parameters:
        statement - that will be deleted

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(PropertyType type,
               java.lang.String value)
        With this method combinations of a PropertyType and a string value can be setted. This combinations are internally known as dynamic properties. The design orientes to Martin Fowlers Defined Dynamic Property-Pattern. The PropertyTypes are managed by the parent project.
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of the property to be set
        value - - the value of the given type

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty(PropertyType propertyType)
        This method returns the value assigned to the delivered propertyType.
        Parameters:
        propertyType - - the desired propertyType
        Returns:
        the value of the given propertyType

      • toJSON

        public org.json.JSONStringer toJSON()
        This method returns a JSONStringer which represents the interview. To transfer this to a client the code can look like this: public Result getJASON(){ Interview interview = Interview.getInterview(UUID.fromString("UUID_STRING")); return ok(interview.toJSON().toString()); } On the client site you can access using jquery: $.getJSON("url.to.getJASON", function(result){ //do something with the result, mabye you ask for the interview name: var interviewName = result.InterviewName }); You have access to the following keys: -InterviewId Returns the interview id, just use it to ask for an interview in the database with the static methods from the Interview class. -InterviewName Returns the interview name -AudioFile This string will be empty if now audiofile was specified -Properties This key contains an array with all properties which were specified in the related project. To access to all this properties, just iterate over this array. Use the key "PropertyType" to access to the name of the Property and use the key "Value" to access to the related values.
        Returns:
        JSONStringer which represents the interview
